Updated 11/24: This trip will ONLY have Manhattan bus stop.

*** FYI: You can easily find FREE street parking near 43rd St & 9th Ave Manhattan on Sunday. ***

Ok, many of you have been asking for Saturday/Holiday Ski day trip and also would like to try different ski resort, let's try out Belleayre Mountain which has been recommended by several members. Here you are.

Ski peak season is here. Are you ready?

Belleayre now stands as a model in the ski industry. Its continued improvements include the only Catskills Cat-access skiing and snowboarding, the Area 51 terrain park, two progression parks, mogul trails ranging from intermediate to expert bumps and extensive glade skiing. Skier and snowboarder visits have grown from 70,000 in 1995 to more than 175,000 skiers and snowboarders from all over the world. With 55 trails, parks and glades, 8 lifts, including our new High Speed Quad, Belleayre Mountain has certainly evolved from humble, yet promising beginnings into an efficient and growing organization - perfection in progress. For more info, check out the official website.

"The Best Place to Learn to Ski in the East" says SKIING Magazine! (Upper-right corner of this link)

*** Trip plan email via Eventbrite will be sent out 2 to 3 days before the event providing the details. ***

Date: December 28th, 2014. Please arrive 30 minutes earlier. 

Depart 6:30 AM from NYC: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of 43rd St & 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Return: Depart from Mountain at 4:30 PM and expect to arrive at NYC at 7:30 PM.

Cost: Includes all mountain lift ticket + bus transportation
This is $15 off comparing to other bus tours (Please bring $2 tips for the driver)
* Early birds $75 for first 28 spots
* Regular $85 for last 27 spots.

Additional Cost:
* $40 to upgrade lift ticket to Beginner Package which include lower-mountain lift ticket, rental package (skis or snowboard), helmet & group lesson.
* $40 for Ski or Snowboard Rental Package. Ski Rental Package includes skis, boots, poles & helmet for Ski Rental Package, and Snowboard Rental Package includes snowboard, boots & helmet.

Buy Ticket Here: http://dec2014belleayre.eventbrite.com You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee  & mention which trip, ticket type & where you will be boarding if you send Quickpay. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) Your spot is NOT confirmed unless payment is received.

Maximum: 55

Transportation: Luxury bus transportation is included.

Refund Policy: 
* Full refund minus $10 processing fee if cancelled 14 days in advance.
* 50% refund if cancelled 7 days in advance. 
* Afterward, no refund for cancellation or no show.
*100% refund if the event is cancelled.

Direction: http://www.belleayre.com/company/direct.htm

Check out more at http://www.belleayre.com/

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt. 

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We will play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:
If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here  for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
PLEASE ONLY RSVP IF YOUR 100% SURE YOU CAN MAKE IT! This is not a beginner level venue.

RSVP Rules

The RSVP will open up 2 days before the scheduled meet up at 8:00 PM Sharp! At that time, you will be able to RSVP for the event. There is a limit of 24 players. It will be 11 VS 11 with 1 sub for each team that will rotate every 7 minutes. Moving forward, we will place a timer on the side line that will alert you when you can sub. Everyone will have to sub at some point of the game. We ask that you only sub when a play comes to an end.

What happens if you are on the waiting list?

ONLY confirmed players will have the opportunity to play. Players on the waiting list can show up if they would like in hopes of a player does not show up. However we will NOT sub you in if all players on the confirmed roster are present. If a player decides to sub you in and you are from the waiting list, then it’s their responsibility to sub for each other and they are NOT allowed to sub out anyone else.

If you show up late  and we had to use a player from the waiting list, then you will lose your spot.  We recommend everyone to show up on time. 

What happens if you RSVP and you do not show up?

You will be placed on the waiting list for the next game. If you continue to RSVP and do not show up, you will be blocked from the group. To avoid this, we ask that you give at least 24 hours notice of changing your RSVP to allow members from the waiting list to join. We understand that emergencies may arise and we will take that into consideration.

IF YOU CHANGE YOUR RSVP TO "NO" ON SUNDAY after 12:00 AM, YOU WILL BE PLACED ON THE WAITING LIST FOR THE FOLLOWING GAME.  if you can please update your RSVP in a timely manner to allow other members to come play. It is not fair for the players are waiting for a spot to get notified a half hour or hour before the game is about to start. 

Violence & language

1.  Slide tackling is NOT allowed

2.  If you become verbally or physically combative with another player, YOU WILL BE BOOTED FROM THE GROUP! We will NOT tolerate any problems.

3.  YOU ARE PLAYING AT YOUR OWN RISK! This group and Jersey City will NOT provide you with insurance coverage.  I request that you that you play at a fun level.

While we are always open to new ideas on how we can improve on this venue, we will NOT change the game play or rules at this time. Please understand that we obtained this beautiful field for us to experience the game at its full length.  Anyone who disturbs the organization rules will be asked to leave. If you wish to make a recommendation, please see the organizers in person first.

Weather Conditions

We will play even if it's raining. The only time we will have to cancel the game if there is lightning or snow on the ground. We will send out an update during the time of the game if the venue is cancelled or not. 

Thank you

results.description:
Winner stays, guys!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XviR7esUvo

And just in case anyone needs a refresher, some guidance from Coach Ted Lasso.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

 

How to get to Queens West Sportsfield.

Queens West Sportsfield is located at:

5th Street between 47th Avenue & 46th Road, Long Island City


From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

From Queensboro it's 3 minutes/3 stops on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

group.name: Bay Ridge FC Get back in shape pickup soccer

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

 

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

 

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

 

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

 

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

 

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

 

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

 

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

 

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

 

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arrming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

 

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

 

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

 

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

 

Regards,

Carlos
results.name: Flag Football Game - Sunday @ 9:00 am

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

venue.address_1: West Houston and West Street, New York, NY 10014

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

 

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

 

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

 

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

 

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

results.description:
Happy Holidays!!  (Note there is a repeat at 3:45pm -please attend one or the other).  This Sunday, December 28th is the last chance this year to ride the nostalgia train.  Do you have a favorite real life subway story or movie scene? If you dare dress in 1920's -1970's attire, we'll have a blast as we socialize and recount the history of the NYC subway and all that it has contributed to the fabric of life here!  With any luck we'll be able to board at the start time a little before 10am and we'll keep riding until around 12 noon. We meet on the uptown platform near the 2nd Avenue entrance.  I will have a sign in case you are new. Note if you arrive in the area extra early, the nearby Whole Foods at 85 East Houston (near Bowery) has an upstairs cafe.

From the MTA website:  "Once again this holiday season, the MTA will offer nostalgia lovers the opportunity to the ride back into the past with rides on vintage buses and subway trains. There’s no better way to get around while doing your holiday shopping! Dating back to the early part of last century, the Nostalgia Train is made up of subway cars in service along the lettered lines between the early1930s to the mid-1970s. Equipped with ceiling fans, padded seats and incandescent light bulbs, the R/1 through R/9 cars served the IND and later some BMT lines. Customers will have the opportunity to hop on board as it operates along the Sixth Avenue  Line."

“Holiday shoppers, tourists and those who just remember a bygone era will have the opportunity to experience a ride on a subway train from yesteryear, said MTA New York City President Carmen Bianco. “With a little bit of luck and good timing, riders will be able to catch a ride on this classic subway train at stations along the  line between Queens Plaza and Second Avenue.”
results.how_to_find_us: 2nd Avenue (Houston Street) station of the F train, going uptown.  Meet on the platform closest to the front of the train - 2nd Avenue Entrance.  I will have a sign should there be a lot of people around.
results.name: Riding the Nostalgia Train and Enjoying NYC Subway History!

results.description:
NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED PICKUP SOCCER GAMES @ RIVERSIDE Park!!

NO CLEATS or PASTIC STUDS!

See our page on Facebook!:

facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ndOMtB9R8GY

DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

We'll play 3 simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check your email or our meetup message board on friday night or before 12.00pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

Riverside Park at West 107 & 108 Street

Take the 1 RED Line Train to Cathedral Pkwy an walk two blocks down, to 108th Street and Riverside Dr.

The field is down the lower level near the river. You can easly access the field from 108th Street. Remember, the field is not visable from the street level, you have to walk down the stairs from Riverside Dr & 108th Street. and you will see the newly renovated fanced-in soccer field next to the river.

Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.50 when you RSVP. This $9.50 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to a local bar for brunch and a Pint or Two.

Village Pourhouse

982 Amsterdam Ave

(between 108th St & 109th St)

New York, NY 10025

(212)[masked]

villagepourhouse.com

results.description:
Let's run to a vintage subway train and then head to a yummy brunch (with drinks).

Each year, the MTA runs classic rail cars from the 30s/40s/50s/60s on the M line between Queens Plaza and 2nd Avenue. We organized a group outing/run to experience this annual event last year, and your organizer thinks it was one of the best outings we have ever had (a bold statement, given our history of amazing adventures). More information is available here:
http://goo.gl/f5BwNW

Our goal is to catch the train leaving Queens Plaza at 10:44am. To accomplish this, we will meet by the Woodside Library at 10:00am and head out for a casual pace 3ish mile run, ending at Queens Plaza. We will explore the subway cars as the train takes us into Manhattan. You will want to bring along your preferred photo-taking device.

If you wish to enjoy a yummy brunch at Radegast Bierhall in Williamsburg after the subway, you are encouraged to follow your organizer who will transfer to the L train at 14th Street. Or, if you'd like to add a few extra miles to your day, you may feel free to exit at 2nd Avenue and run over the Williamsburg Bridge and meet at Radegast. Or, you may head off to your next destination. The choice is up to you. [Organizer's Note: Radegast has great brunch...lemon ricotta pancakes are out of this world. And the beverage selection just makes it all that much better.]

Our run will be at a casual pace - you are welcome to participate as long as you are able to complete a full 3ish miles without stopping. This is for your safety and to ensure that the group does not miss the train.

Please don't forget to bring along your Metrocard,  and your ID if you plan to join us for brunch.

Hello My Fellow Jets Friends:

Nobody in our Jets group is aware of this but I found out before the Jets season started that my building/apt which has been the Jets meetup location of some great pre-game parties prior to Jets playoff games and other pre-games which have been a lot of fun to make and be a part of is going to be demolished.  Everyone in my building has to be gone by January 30th.  A high rise apt will be built in its place.

I want to invite everyone to be part of one final Jets meetup party here at my apartment.  When I say everyone, I am including fellow Jets fans who I have not seen in a long time. We will have drinks, food, and remember the great times hanging out here waiting for a big playoff game or just hanging out together before a regular season game.  

It has been a tough season but I want to end the season on a high note. Austin would like to see everyone too.

I hope that you can make it.

HH

results.description:
This run will be beginner-friendly, but we welcome runners at all levels. We will be running anywhere from 2 - 6ish miles depending on what everyone is looking to do. 

The main starting point will be at Columbus Circle by the gold statue (not the silver unisphere).

Here are some options:

Advanced: 
6 miles: Lots of hills. Run along the full outer loop of the park. The hills are more challenging if you run counter-clockwise. 

Intermediate: 
~5 miles: Run along the outer loop but cut across the 102nd st traverse.  You'll skip the infamous Harlem hill.

Beginner: 
1.7 miles: Run around the lower loop. Cut across the 72st traverse and hang a left again once you hit the west side, end back at Columbus Circle.

If possible we will break into pace groups, but either way lets meet back at the USS Maine Monument around 12-12:15am.

Where do I leave my stuff? 
The New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center (located on the 2nd floor) has open bins, and lockers behind the cash register. To use the lockers, you must bring your own lock. They also have changing rooms. These services are free. The New York Running Company opens at 11am on Sunday. 

What time does the run actually start?
Plan on arriving at 11am, but we won't start running until about 11:15am in case people need to change or drop off their stuff at the NY Running Company. We will not wait longer that 11:15am.

results.description:
This run will be beginner-friendly, but we welcome runners at all levels. We will be running anywhere from 2 - 6ish miles depending on what everyone is looking to do. 

The main starting point will be at Columbus Circle by the gold statue (not the silver unisphere).

Here are some options:

Advanced: 
6 miles: Lots of hills. Run along the full outer loop of the park. The hills are more challenging if you run counter-clockwise. 

Intermediate: 
~5 miles: Run along the outer loop but cut across the 102nd st traverse.  You'll skip the infamous Harlem hill.

Beginner: 
1.7 miles: Run around the lower loop. Cut across the 72st traverse and hang a left again once you hit the west side, end back at Columbus Circle.

If possible we will break into pace groups, but either way lets meet back at the USS Maine Monument around 11-11:15am.

Where do I leave my stuff?
The New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center (located on the 2nd floor) has open bins, and lockers behind the cash register. To use the lockers, you must bring your own lock. They also have changing rooms. These services are free. The New York Running Company opens at 11am on Sunday.

What time does the run actually start? 
Plan on arriving at 11am, but we won't start running until about 11:15am in case people need to change or drop off their stuff at the NY Running Company. We will not wait longer than 11:15am. 


After the run once everyone is together again, we can grab some food nearby. Our goto place is typically Cosmic Diner on 52nd and 8th ave. Hot chocolate, coffee, pancakes? Mmmm.. If anyone wants to suggest a different place that is close by, we're flexible.


Call/text Henry at (646)[masked] if you have any questions or are having trouble finding us.

Dig deep and drag yourself out to go for a run! You'll be glad you did!

results.description:
This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network, Random events and several other partner Meet Up Groups. .  The number of RSVP's listed here reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions regarding this event please contact Dave directly at [masked].

This is an amazing day to take this tour! Join us as we enjoy a rare opportunity to ride in a subway car from the early-mid 1900's aboard the Nostalgia Train! Following the train ride you will enjoy a great history tour of Grand Central and check out the Holiday Train Show at The Transit Museum Annex.  80% of this tour takes place under cover or inside! Enjoy a fresh and different way to enjoy a Sunday afternoon with other fun people from NYC. Learn tons of cool things on the tour with a few dozen members and friends from several Meet Up Groups, then enjoy an optional post tour bite to eat at The Grand Central Food Court.

Our tours are designed for fun and friendly members of NYSN and our partner social networking groups.  This is not a tour for tourists but for people who live in and around NY or who are new to the area who want to learn more about the city they live in and the amazing things they are surrounded by every day!  Celebrate the 101 year anniversary of Grand Central with this fun and informative to while socializing with members and friends from NYSN and other Social Networking Groups. Did you know that the current Grand Central building is actually the 3rd incarnation of the historic building on that site?  Learn about Secret platforms, top secret rooms and interesting facts and surprises during this adventure filled with exploring, socializing and learning.  Your tour guide will also share  photos from the late 1800’s and early 1900’s that will  amaze you and change your perspective on the building and the neighborhood surrounding it.

Sign up today and meet other fun people in our group while really getting a different perspective on one of  New York’s most famous landmarks and the neighborhood surrounding it.

The group will meet at The Starbuck's at 14th street and 6th avenue for the ride up to 42nd street and Grand Central on the Nostalgia Train.  You will need to use your Metro Card.

What to wear: Dress for the weather. Casual

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What to expect: 20 -30 fun and friendly people looking to learn a little about the city and meet new people.

Please bring exact change $15

The entire experience should be finished by 1:30pm

Hi Guys,

Thanks for signing up for the tour.  I will meet the group in front of the Starbucks at 510 6th avenue and 14th street and 6th avenue between 11am-11:15am .  If you miss the meeting location and the train you will miss the tour!  Please arrive on time.  Check www.mta.info for subway service changes. Please call my cell if you get lost[masked]-1098.

You will need to swipe in your metrocard at 14th street,  I will not be able to meet group on Subway because no phone service below.

If you have not prepaid, please bring exact change $15

Thanks

Dave

results.description:
During the warmer months we seek to play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside for Tuesdays, Thursdays and Sundays and Morningside for Saturdays. 

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

While I may not always be there, feel free to text me for updates.

Damien
[masked]

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP RESPONSIBLY.  YOU MUST BE 21 OR OLDER TO ATTEND THIS EVENT, AND YOU MUST BRING YOUR ID.

 

So, who wants to spend the last Sunday of 2014 at a full day, karaoke marathon?!?! Seven hours of fun, laughs and songs for only $14!! We will start at 1 pm, and can sing, non-stop until 8 pm.

This place has drinks (perfect for those like me who need a little "liquid encouragement" to sing). And we are allowed to bring in food (we can even order delivery).  However, you cannot bring in any outside drinks.  Not even water, but they provide free pitchers of water there.

And don't say "I can't sing", because I can guarantee you that most people who come to these are not winning American Idol any time soon! Well, maybe Vanessa.  But, it's all about having fun and a few laughs!! Trust me, it's a lot of fun, and everyone usually ends up singing along, so you're not totally in the spotlight.  Maybe that's why they have the word "Duet" in the name of the place.

Please, go to www.karaokeduet.com and check out the song selection.  They have the song codes, so write at least a few down and come prepared to start singing right away!! But there are songs that they have in a book of "newly added" songs that aren't yet up on their website.  So if you don't see your favorite, it may still be available!  Last time we were there, the group sang almost 100 songs in total!!

In order to make sure that everyone gets equal opportunity to sing, the way we're going to run this event is that everyone can add whatever song (with the code) that they want to sing to a sign-up sheet that I will bring.  Then I will add the songs to the queue so that it is evenly spread out.  With this in mind, it would be beneficial to look at the song list online in advance, and come with your list (including the song codes), so you at least have a few to start off with.

REMEMBER, YOU MUST BRING YOUR ID TO  SHOW THAT YOU ARE OVER 21!

Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

Gloria/Wen/Tyler/Gerald will be the host(s) of the meetup. Please find him/her if you need belay partners. 


Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Get a $24 meetup discount (day pass only, either first wed or sun of the month, whichever comes first). Monthly membership of $95 (start up fee waived). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group call/message the event host at [*****contact # will be sent out pre-event].  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door. Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable haha ;)

Notice to beginners: if you have never ever climbed before don't worry we will let you climb and be your slave belayers but keep in mind, this is gonna cost you a beer afterwards :) lol ...i'm only half kidding btw ;)) Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. we leave the teaching to the experts. If you wanna  learn how to belay you can take a class there. There is a nominal fee for this. Check out their website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;) just kidding.

What is your 2015 resolution? Whether you are considering ending a relationship or are ready for a new one—start moving towards your 2015 goals NOW!

I will use my expertise in NLP, EFT, Reiki, and meditation to guide you through some techniques to clear away blocks that are holding you back or may hold you back. A little breathing, visualization, and persistence will get you there.

results.description:
Sometimes it's helpful to write in a group. So in this meeting we're coming together to just write. No critiques, no audiences (unless you want one), no pressure but that which you put on yourself.  Here's how it works:


Part 1: 

3:00- 3:45 we will write from a prompt provided by the organizer or one of the attending members.


Part 2:  

3:50 - 5:50 is dedicated time for free writing. Work on whatever you want.  We'd hope that work generated during these sessions will be submitted to any of the other Meetups or for broadcast on our podcast, Kaleidocast.


Please feel free to bring drinks or snacks. Arielle has power strips to plug in and space to write at both a table and on couches and chairs. Also, there are two cats, in case anyone has allergies.

See you there!
results.name: Arielle's BSFW Writing Room

results.description:
This year marks the 50th Anniversary of the passage of the Civil Rights Act of 1964. 


In many ways, the race relations appear to be at the all-time low in America in the recent years.  Additionally, the so-called "Police-Community Divide" keeps growing further apart -- especially in light of the events that unfolded in Ferguson, Staten Island, and elsewhere.


For this event, let's take a closer look at: where we've been, where we are . . . and most importantly, where do we go from here?


As always, we'll strive for civil and thoughtful discussions on this thorny and explosive topic.
results.name: Civil Rights Act of 1964: A Lookback After 50 Years

results.description:
Once again this holiday season, the MTA will offer nostalgia lovers the opportunity to the ride back into the past with rides on vintage buses and subway trains. There’s no better way to get around while doing your holiday shopping! Dating back to the early part of last century, the Nostalgia Train is made up of subway cars in service along the lettered lines between the early1930s to the mid-1970s. Equipped with ceiling fans, padded seats and incandescent light bulbs, the R/1 through R/9 cars served the IND and later some BMT lines. Customers will have the opportunity to hop on board as it operates along the Sixth Avenue M Subway Line Icon Line.

“Holiday shoppers, tourists and those who just remember a bygone era will have the opportunity to experience a ride on a subway train from yesteryear, said MTA New York City President Carmen Bianco. “With a little bit of luck and good timing, riders will be able to catch a ride on this classic subway train at stations along the M Subway Line Icon line between Queens Plaza and Second Avenue.”

Many New Yorkers bear fond memories of the trains. However, with the cars having been out of service for nearly 40 years, many more New Yorkers have never experienced the charm of wicker seats and ceiling fans. The holiday “Nostalgia Train” will operate on Sundays only, between the hours of 10 a.m. and 5 p.m., with the last one on December 28th.

NOSTALGIA TRAIN HIGHLIGHTS:

Car No. 100 --- Manufactured by American Car and Foundry, this R1-type car was the first car in the initial order of 300 cars placed in service for the opening of the IND subway.

Car No. 484 --- Part of a 500-car order of R4 cars manufactured by American Car & Foundry. In 1946, this car received a retrofit of bulls-eye lighting and a public address system.

Car No. 1575 – Originally manufactured as an R7, this car was involved in a wreck in 1946. Sent to the American Car & Foundry factory, the car, which is equipped with fluorescent lighting and smooth sides, was rebuilt as the prototype of the next generation R10 subway car.

The nostalgia won’t be limited to the subway. Bus customers using the M42 crosstown route will have the opportunity to ride a vintage New York City bus for the holiday season. Everything will be original except the fare. The crosstown buses run from Monday through Friday, December 1st through December 19th .

The historic fleet is appreciated by Transit's top managers for their historic significance. "These buses are a living, breathing part of the city's history and each has a unique story to tell about the era in which it operated," says Darryl Irick, Senior VP of NYC Transit Department of Buses and President of MTA Bus and a former Bus Operator himself. "When you examine this collection as a whole, the progression of motorized surface transportation in New York City really comes to life."

Many of the vehicles in NYC Transit’s historic fleet have been deemed to have historical significance to the city, including bus number 3100, a 1956 GM which was the first air-conditioned transit bus to operate in the City, and 5227, the last non wheelchair-accessible bus to operate for NYC Transit, pulled from service in 1993.

While most of the preserved and restored vehicles were ordered and operated by NYC Transit, the earliest buses belonged to predecessor companies, notably the Fifth Avenue Coach Company, which was founded in 1885. The historic fleet is made up largely of so-called "old look" buses (built prior to the Autumn of 1959) and "new look" models (buses with slanted windows and enlarged windshields built in Pontiac, Michigan from the Autumn of 1959 until the introduction of the RTS in 1977).

General Motors and Flxible are the most heavily represented manufacturers, though there is also a 1956 Mack in the collection. Interestingly, all three companies are now out of the bus-building business.
results.name: Nostalgia Train

results.description:
Happy Holidays!!  This Sunday, December 28th is the last chance this year to ride the nostalgia train. (Note there is a morning option - please RSVO for one or the other).  Do you have a favorite real life subway story or movie scene? If you dare dress in 1920's -1970's attire, we'll have a blast as we socialize and recount the history of the NYC subway and all that it has contributed to the fabric of life here!  With any luck (assuming the schedule is adhered to), we'll be able to board at the last scheduled start time at 2nd Avenue a little before 4:00pm and we'll do one round trip finishing a little after 5pm.  We meet on the uptown platform near the 2nd Avenue entrance. I will have a sign in case you are new. Note if you arrive in the area early, the nearby Whole Foods at 85 East Houston (near Bowery) has an upstairs cafe.

From the MTA website:  "Once again this holiday season, the MTA will offer nostalgia lovers the opportunity to the ride back into the past with rides on vintage buses and subway trains. There’s no better way to get around while doing your holiday shopping! Dating back to the early part of last century, the Nostalgia Train is made up of subway cars in service along the lettered lines between the early1930s to the mid-1970s. Equipped with ceiling fans, padded seats and incandescent light bulbs, the R/1 through R/9 cars served the IND and later some BMT lines. Customers will have the opportunity to hop on board as it operates along the Sixth Avenue  Line."

“Holiday shoppers, tourists and those who just remember a bygone era will have the opportunity to experience a ride on a subway train from yesteryear, said MTA New York City President Carmen Bianco. “With a little bit of luck and good timing, riders will be able to catch a ride on this classic subway train at stations along the  line between Queens Plaza and Second Avenue.”
results.how_to_find_us: 2nd Avenue (Houston Street) station of the F train, going uptown.  Meet on the platform closest to the front of the train - 2nd Avenue Entrance.  I will have a sign should there be a lot of people around.
results.name: Riding the Nostalgia Train and Enjoying NYC Subway History!

results.description:
Join us on a Sunday afternoon and practice another language in a relaxed and friendly environment while having a drink or food! Meet and converse with our members from all over the world while learning their native language and helping them to learn yours! Our members are interested in your language & culture so come make new friends! All levels are welcome!


You will:
Meet and practice a foreign language with native speakers and help them learn your native language!

Come learn & practice:

English / Spanish / French / Italian / Portuguese / Chinese / Japanese / Korean / Russian / German / Arabic 

How?
Each table has a flag and is designated for a specific language, where we split up in small groups to facilitate conversation. Go to the table of the language you are looking for, introduce yourself & join the group! Start practicing while simultaneously helping others to learn your native language! At any moment feel free to walk around and change to another table and practice that language! We have very friendly members that will totally make you feel welcome!

Note:
 To attend this event, you must support venue by buying at least one drink even if its juice, soda or ordering food. Members who do not want to buy food or a drink please wait for next event.

This is a language exchange event, so please help others by spending at least 1/4 of your time helping out in your native language.

Happy Hour discounts & food available for our group members!
$6 Beer
$6 Red & White Wine
$7 Cocktails

IMPORTANT (we remove members that break rules):
1. Please CHECK-IN with us to fill name tag out, this lets all know you are part of our group, facilitates you going up to anyone and saying hello and using their name thus creating a friendlier atmosphere!

2. Fee to cover group costs, 4-6pm $2.00, 6-7pm $3.00. Also you must cover for your guest even if they don't end up coming since the RSVP was taken. Please don't show yourself surprised when we ask you for the fee....We know you know there's a fee!  :)

3. Members must support our venue by buying at least one drink even if its juice or soda or ordering food so we can keep returning to venue.

4. Members must RSVP to attend. Sometimes our events have limited space so if you cannot come please update your RSVP status before it closes, so other members have the opportunity to come. (members that RSVP yes and don't show 3 times will be removed from the group)

results.description:
Do not harden your heart: https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=u4GOWKBEc3Q&list=UUowkPA97YRdpjgbD4pqdXYQ 


The entire bible was written by God so how can we understand God's will without knowing the word? How can we be a good Christian without fully understanding God's will? What is God's will as described in the ultimate book of blessings, Revelation? If we may be living in the time of Revelation isn't it time for us to fully understand this book? This will be part of a series that focuses on Revelation, God's book of hope for us Today!

The bible is not a collection of 66 unrelated books but one connected story of God's people and only through the bible may we understand God's will and His plan for us in Revelation's time. So let's explore the deep mysteries of the bible in this very revealing and eye opening bible discussion and delve into what God, the Father and our Savior Jesus want to reveal to us through the book of Revelation while getting to know one another in fellowship and praise. You will never see the bible the same way again.

results.description:
This is our LAST LoVE meet up of the year. 

It just can NOT be the same as all the previous sessions. It needs to be a reflection time for all of us, to make a yearly summary, to review our joint experience together! 


Each and every person, shy or not, introvert or extravert, will all have an undivided time and attention slot to speak up, regarding:

1. What was your initial expectations for the LoVE group?

2. What have you gained from your attendance and participation in the group? What words, experience, or detailed memories of the group or members' that touched you...in 2014?

3. Which areas would you like to learn more about? Which areas we could improve the group next year?

...

I will also share my plan for the group in 2015. 


Your suggestions and opinions matter! 

Please come and make an impact!!

p.s. Please dress festively! After all, it's HOLIDAY season and we are going to take a group photos together as a good-bye to 2014! :)

I look forward for you to joining us in person soon. 

 

Ping 

Founder

results.description:
Beginning this Sunday, November through December,  we will watch a film that dramatizes spiritual lessons then discuss the film through the lens of Rosicrucianism.

Our selection for this week is Inner Worlds, Outer Worlds 

Summary: There is one vibratory field that connects all things. It has been called Akasha, Logos, the primordial OM, the music of the spheres, the Higgs field, dark energy, and a thousand other names throughout history. The vibratory field is at the root of all true spiritual experience and scientific investigation. It is the same field of energy that saints, Buddhas, yogis, mystics, priests, shamans and seers, have observed by looking within themselves. Many of history's monumental thinkers, such a Pythagoras, Kepler, Leonardo DaVinci, Tesla, and Einstein, have come to the threshold of this great mystery. It is the common link between all religions, all sciences, and the link between our inner worlds and our outer worlds.
results.name: Spiritual Movie Night: Inner Worlds, Outer Worlds

results.description:
FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbritelink below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.

Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PRE-PAYMENT ONLY WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2014nycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

If you don't get any matches, you'll receive a promo code so you can try another event at half price!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 32-45

results.description:
Gather this Sunday evening from 6:00-8:00pm at 48 Wall Street (5th Floor) to join with a diverse group of New Yorkers for a weekend recharge through conversation with friends, food, and rich discussion on relevant topics from the Bible.  This is a great place to ask the tough questions, find answers, and grow in faith.  People of all faith background and seekers who consider themselves "irreligious" will all feel comfortable here.  Leave each time feeling balanced and ready for the busy week ahead.

This week's discussion has been dubbed: "How to Delete Your Guilt & Start Fresh in 2015."  Wow - quite an interesting title, but it sparks our interest because many of us have blown it once or twice (or even thrice) this past year.  It leaves us wondering:

• What do I have to do to be 100% certain I am on good terms with the God of the Bible?

• What happens if I have committed the same wrong act many times over?

• Is it possible to delete the guilt for my wrongdoings so that it doesn't count against me in the end?

• How do I know whether or not I will be eligible for Heaven?

• Is there some accountant in Heaven carefully weigh my good & bad deeds on a balance in order to see which wins out?

• If there really a loving God out there who wants to forgive me, or is the idea of forgiveness just a fairy tale?

The Bible hasn't left us in a hopeless wrestling match with our questions.  Woven into the central theme of the Bible's storyline is the answer to many of our deepest questions about morality, sin, guilt, and what to do when we blow it.  We just need to know where to look for the answer, and this is exactly what we are gathering to do this Sunday evening.  Bring your brain, a pen and notebook, and the will to engage.

Let us know you're coming!
results.how_to_find_us: Text (608) 609-8400 if there is no one at the door, and we will come down to let you in.
results.name: Weekly Bible Discussion: How to Delete Your Guilt & Start Fresh in 2015

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

[masked]

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see the row of 5-6 metal doors. Ring the buzzer (on your right) twice and someone will open the door for you. (BTW, once inside the school, the gym is straight ahead).

results.description:
Gather this Sunday evening from 6:00-8:00pm at 48 Wall Street (5th Floor) to join with a diverse group of New Yorkers for a weekend recharge through conversation with friends, food, and rich discussion on relevant topics from the Bible. This is a great place to ask the tough questions, find answers, and grow in faith. People of all faith background and seekers who consider themselves "irreligious" will all feel comfortable here. Leave each time feeling balanced and ready for the busy week ahead.

This week's discussion has been dubbed: "How to Delete Your Guilt & Start Fresh in 2015." Wow - quite an interesting title, but it sparks our interest because many of us have blown it once or twice (or even thrice) this past year. It leaves us wondering:

~ What do I have to do to be 100% certain I am on good terms with the God of the Bible?
~ What happens if I have committed the same wrong act many times over?
~ Is it possible to delete the guilt for my wrongdoings so that it doesn't count against me in the end?
~ How do I know whether or not I will be eligible for Heaven?
~ Is there some accountant in Heaven carefully weigh my good & bad deeds on a balance in order to see which wins out?
~ If there really a loving God out there who wants to forgive me, or is the idea of forgiveness just a fairy tale?

The Bible hasn't left us in a hopeless wrestling match with our questions. Woven into the central theme of the Bible's storyline is the answer to many of our deepest questions about morality, sin, guilt, and what to do when we blow it. We just need to know where to look for the answer, and this is exactly what we are gathering to do this Sunday evening. Bring your brain, a pen and notebook, and the will to engage.

Let us know you're coming!
results.name: Weekly Bible Discussion: How to Delete Your Guilt & Start Fresh in 2015

results.description:
FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.

Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PRE-PAYMENT ONLY WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2014nycspeeddating.eventbrite.com</a>

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

If you don't get any matches, you'll receive a promo code so you can try another event at half price!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our <a href="http://andthatswhyyouresingle.com/">main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.

results.description:
What is it: In addition to the monthly "larger" meetups, this is a smaller but more intimate meeting with a looser agenda. Please come ready to share and discuss your problems. We will cap the number of attendees to about 20 for this one to keep the discussion intimate. We will also ask people to send things they may want to discuss ahead of time.

Here are some of the things that were talked about in this forum:

• One CTO was thinking through how to split out his teams as his overall technical team was growing and taking more projects.

• Shared a situation where his team wanted to adopt a new technology,

• A person who is launching his startup was figuring out how to hire first few people to expand the team. 

• Another person is hiring a very particular role of cloud sales engineer and was looking for ways to increase the pipeline, and also how to interview for intangibles like being very driven. 

• One person was struggling with a very significant downsizing of his team, and finding himself with more different technologies used across different projects than the number of people in his team. 

• Another shared experiences using a professional candidate vetter when hiring.
results.name: December CTO Roundtable

How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.

What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.

Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.

Workshop Contents:

results.description:
Do you feel stuck creatively?

Do you fear if people see or hear your creative work, they will reject it?  They will reject you?

Do you think you are too lazy to do your creative work?

Do you tell yourself you don't have the time or energy to do your creative work?

Do you hate being judged as an artist ("artist" includes all the arts here)?

Do you criticize your own creative work harshly?

Do you think being creative is just too darn hard and that you are not cut out for it?

Do you think you are not talented enough to be successful, so why bother?

Do you think you "have too much going on" to set aside time to do your creative work?

Do you compare yourself to other creative artists and think you "come up short"?

Do you yearn to be creative but think you just don't have it in you?

If someone criticizes your work, does it get you down?

If someone appreciates your creative work, do you think they are being insincere and just trying to flatter you?

If you answer is yes to any on of these, then I invite you to join this meetup.  

So many of us aspire to be artistic in one form or the other, but we carry within us hindrances to either doing our work or moving it out into the world (commonly called “marketing”) -- or both. 

We think we are not good enough, our work is not good enough, will be judged, we lack enough talent or imagination or commitment or time, we can’t trust the future, we need more ambition and drive, and on and on. We cannot get beyond our fears and start doing our artistic work full-out and then putting our work out there for others to experience. We become closeted artists, and if we do manage to express ourselves artistically, we shy away from sharing it with others, with the world — full-out. 

We fear criticism mostly. Failure. Rejection. We want to be approved of, to be appreciated and recognized. Being appreciated is not bad, but when it becomes more important than our self-expression, it doesn't bring any fulfillment at all. Mainly, we are just too self-critical. There is nothing holding us back but us. 

When we see this negative pattern with gentle guidance, we can laugh at the illogic of it all and move into doing our creative work with passion and inspiration. The seriousness is gone, so our "work" becomes our "play." We will use The Work of Byron Katie, a powerful but gentle tool for self-investigation, to get at our deep, underlying beliefs that stop us from fulfilling our dreams to write, dance, paint, sculpt, act, play music, make a movie, cook, create a business, do anything that we want to do. Join us and get to work on the beliefs and fears that stop you from being the fully creative person you secretly want to be.

A little about me: 

I am an artist and writer and have been a working actor in film, television and theatre, a journalist,  a club musician, and a teacher.  I've written over 20 plays, some of which were performed Off-Broadway and in Europe. My art has garnered over 25 exhibitions and can be seen at <a>www.benhendersonpainting.com. </a>I have also written five screenplays, one of which that has been sold.  I have coached at least 100 creative artists in moving forward with their careers.  I have practiced The Work of Byron Katie for 8 years and lead inquiry groups using her work for over seven.  I lead  writing workshops in New York as well.   One is called "The Writer's Gym" which you can check out at

http://www.meetup.com/Writers-Gym-for-Playwrights-and-Screenwriters/


and the other is "Memoir Writing" at

http://www.meetup.com/usingthe-pastforideas-com/events/216785252/ 


I hope to meet you soon!    

Ben, Your Organizer
results.name: Dissolve the Internal Blocks that Thwart Our  Creative Expression

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:50 pm, Thu. 11 am – 12 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

 

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles
